title: Release migration
description: Identifies the changes in configurations of Active TV Releases

product.name: CloudTv
product.summary_of_changes: 1.-Simulcrypt support for IP delivery 2.-Scale grouping 3.-Data Collector improvements 4.-reporting pipeline improvements 5.-RFB-TV plugin support for generating key repeatevents 6.-setting for control IP ofSession Manager member 7.-handling of videocapabilities of clients 8.-subscription logic from StreamingEngine to Scaler 9.-DataCollector HTTPS and proxy support

attribute_modifications.attribute_description: The scale grouping functionality allows an operator that uses a Scaler cluster in dynamic mode to group the Scaler Nodes.
attribute_modifications.explanation_text: This can be used to reduce wasting bandwidth in an operator network when Scaler jobs are only used by a subset of the Stitchers in the deployment.

attribute_modifications.attribute_description: The RFB-TV plugin has three new options to enable and configure key repeat events.
attribute_modifications.explanation_text: The interval the Session Manager waits after a key down event from the client before starting key repeats. When this interval expires, without having received a new key event, the Session Manager starts generat- ing keyDown events with the key code that was received last, until the maxKeyRepeatDuration is reached or a new key event occurs. Zero (0) dis- ables key repeat behavior. Minimum value is 0, maximum is 1000

attribute_modifications.attribute_description: The RFB-TV plugin has three new options to enable and configure key repeat events.
attribute_modifications.explanation_text: Interval to issue keyDown messages to the application. Keys are repeated with the specified interval until the client transmits another key event or until the maxKeyRepeatDuration is reached. A value of 0 disables key repeat key repeat behavior. Maximum value is 1000

attribute_modifications.attribute_description: The RFB-TV plugin has three new options to enable and configure key repeat events.
attribute_modifications.explanation_text: Maximum duration of key repeat behavior. When this timer expires or the Session Manager receives another key, the Session Manager generates a keyUp event of the key it was repeating and stops repeating. Minimum value is 0, maximum is 300000 (5 minutes).
